page.title: 02HOUSES and CHARITIES.
page.content: Many of the older{houses}are 17c timber framed,most new houses are brick.In 1965 there were about 169 dwellings, since then 71 new houses have been built,46 of them in 1973/4, opposite the council houses. 3 houses have been "transplanted"; Melrose,once {"Mucky Matthews"}cottage from Shobdon; {Ayers Barn}from Wooferton and {"Oldfield"}from Leinthall Starkes. 13 dwellings have been converted from old barns or stables,1 tiny cottage at the top of Welshman's Lane was demolished. The{village school}was closed in 1968, the sale of{School House}led eventually to an{Education Foundation} in 1978, giving grants to under 25's for courses, books etc.,C.E.Barker chairs this committee.There remains a small{bread charity,Yarpole Nursing} {Assn.}helps needy sick at Christmas.
